short_summary: Fabricate and supply one, all welded aluminum commercial 6.1 meter vessel.
description: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) has a requirement for the fabrication and supply of (1)one, all welded aluminum commercial 6.1 meter vessel with twin engines and Trailer built in accordance with Annex A – Technical Statement of Requirement (TSOR) and Annex C – Bidder questions and Canada Responses.
duration_in_months: The contract duration is approximately 24 months.
full_summary:
**M5000-241133 - 6.1m Welded Aluminium Boat Tender Notice** 
===============

**Issued on** 
--------------- 
February 20, 2024

**Closing Date** 
---------------- 
April 3, 2024, 2:00 PM Eastern Time

**Notice ID** 
------------ 
18851113

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) has issued a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the fabrication and supply of one (1) commercial 6.1 meter aluminum vessel with twin engines and trailer. 

**Summary**
----------

* 1 x 6.1m commercial aluminum vessel with twin engines and trailer
* Fabricated and supplied in accordance with Annex A – Technical Statement of Requirement (TSOR)
* Compliance with Comprehensive Land Claims Agreements:
	+ Inuvialuit Final Agreement
	+ Gwich'in Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement

**Background**
-------------

This procurement aims to meet the RCMP's needs for a vessel that meets stringent technical specifications.

**Proposal Requirements**
------------------------

Bidders must submit proposals that demonstrate their ability to deliver the vessel within the specified requirements. Proposals must include the following:

* Technical specifications of the proposed vessel
* Manufacturing process
* Quality control measures
* Delivery and installation timelines
* Compliance with applicable regulations and standards

**Additional Information**
-------------------------

* Trade Agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Regions of Opportunity: None
* Regions of Delivery: Northwest Territories

**Contact Information**
----------------------

For more information, please contact:

Patrick Wass
Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
Phone: *Not Provided*
Email: [patrick.wass@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:patrick.wass@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

**Document Tracking**
-------------------

For the latest status on this tender, please visit:
https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18851113?extsite=MTg4NTExMTNfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==


Note:
As per the contract, bid evaluation criteria and the procurement process will be managed by the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) on behalf of the RCMP. Bidders are expected to respect the timelines and requirements outlined in this notice. A link to the detailed tender documents, including RPC and specifications, can be found at the provided document tracking URL.INFRINGEMENT FINANCING CORPORATION YEAR OTHERWISE BELONG
